title: My problem with League, { Realized after 14 Day suspension }
body:
Hi I was band, well its my secondary account and I don't mind so much I want to say that I got screwed over in game. There are a lot of toxic players on league and well I, being the one harassed got banded. Well I say go fuck yourself, in utmost kindest way possible. In the past I reported people when needed too, after awhile I gave up since no one ever got banded they just continued playing on. I got reported one time and got on a  14 day suspension. Okay well this doesn't make a lick on sense. 

I think I am done with your game, you message comes across as a professional, and serious game. How so? when there are people trolling players like me and I get seen as the bad guy.  I thought this game was something I would come back to and play for a long time. Spend some money after the new patch. Well I was wrong, I made new friends and had fun only to find myself  getting band, because I was getting screwed over in game.  Also seriously the first suspension last for 14 days then perma ban,  wtf is that! Your basically stealing money from people over something that happened in one game. Id rather play DOTA if that's the case.

 Everything comes down to who actually is the one checking out the log and video to see what all happened, have a good day Grimixxz. Ps. I know your going to have some sort of response saying sorry for the inconveniences, or something witty well this time you got it wrong. I was the one being harassed. Therefore this game is no longer a game, its now  simply a cash grab. I cant play a game where every thing I join is just another toxic gameplay. Even being able to play again just makes me think that its not even worth my time.

replies.body:
I know it can feel a bit extreme to have gone straight to a permaban after one game, but some things simply aren't okay to say to others while playing our game. I did look over the chat from that game to see just what exactly happened, and calling your own teammates things like retarded and trash just aren't cool regardless of who started it to begin with. Another point that might have played into the ban might have been when you started to brag about inting or that you didn't care about a ban because "this wasn't your main account". 

I don't want to throw out your entire personal chat logs, but if you're still confused as to why this ban was placed you can shoot a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) over to our player behavior team for the full context.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=mbhBQN7Z,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-03T00:59:44.566+0000)
>
> Another point that might have played into the ban might have been when you started to brag about inting or that you didn't care about a ban because "this wasn't your main account". 

Real question: when this happens, does Riot attempt to find and punish the user's main account as well?  It honestly seems like they should.  If someone is toxic and has multiple accounts, it's not like playing under a different summoner name makes them a different person

That's a fair question to be concerned with, but ultimately we can't discuss other players accounts or punishments. 

Real talk: I know that's not what any of you want to hear, but we simply need to retain some level of privacy with peoples personal accounts. I know you're all concerned with our punishment systems, but with your reports we can help take action on those who need it.

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=mbhBQN7Z,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2017-10-04T20:27:32.390+0000)
>
> That's a fair question to be concerned with, but ultimately we can't discuss other players accounts or punishments. 
> 
> Real talk: I know that's not what any of you want to hear, but we simply need to retain some level of privacy with peoples personal accounts. I know you're all concerned with our punishment systems, but with your reports we can help take action on those who need it.

The answer is unsatisfying, but I appreciate and respect your candor

Yeah, some of things I had said I personally regret but, when a person is constantly joining a game and constantly being messed with because of toxic players, its pretty upsetting. Usually when I join a game I don't say stuff the would be to "risky" but that particular game just seems I was very angry about the situation. I would like to apologies to the other player about what was said. I didn't like the circumstances and I was being asked to gank mid when I was obviously behind. Belittling and steal my farm on purpose was a contributing factor. Someone had stole my buff for jungle in the beginning of the game and yes I was distraught,  but another player was instigating me.

In all I would like to apologies to you and the players of that game and I will make sure it will not happen again. I will accept the 14 day ban, the fact of it being my secondary account shouldn't have matter. I am trying to make it my main, and I should learn to control my anger. Like I previously stated I will not let it happen again, and I will accept the 14 day ban because it will give me time to think. Thanks for responding, yours truly Grimixxz. I do not know if you can personally contact the other players of that game, though if you could I wish you could send this letter to them or that fact that I wish to apologies to them for what had happened.

Thanks for not putting out my personal chat, I had time to think about what I had said over night. Wish to apologies to you personally, for my first letter, I should have been more understanding of the situation. I will continue to play league in a professional and fun way. May be hard to believe but, I really wont let any of this happen again. Have a good day Broporo

Then can u put a mute button for ourselves instead of the teammates, that way even if i trash talk the whole game being tilted at least none of it will be sent. Sometimes i just want to type a lot of shit about my teammates just to cool myself down.

I getcha man, I really do. We've all been there before where we just needed to get a little steam out. I've even personally had to mash out my feelings on the keyboard, but you always have to choice of sending those messages or not. Think of the backspace button as your personal mute.
